newsitem.title: BELGIUM: GHENT TO HELP REDEVELOP BRAZILIAN PORT OF ANTONINA.
newsitem.headline: GHENT TO HELP REDEVELOP BRAZILIAN PORT OF ANTONINA.

text.p: Ghent Harbour Authority is working with the Brazilian authorities at Antonina in a bid to redevelop the South American port.
Eddy Daniels, Ghent deputy commercial director, said the Belgian port has taken on a commercial and technical constancy role at the Brazilian port.
"The Brazilians are financing the project and Ghent will provide the know-how," he said. Ghent will also provide staff training. Antonina is in the same bay as the major soybean
exporting port of Paranagua, south of Sao Paulo. It comprises a 100,000 sq metre site.
A 360 metre quay wall and a new terminal on reclaimed land will be built. Work has just started and is forecast to be completed by the end of 1998 or early 1999.
"There is a lot of interest in the area, especially from car manufacturers," added Daniels. Renault is in the process of building a plant near Paranagua.
Warehouses and coldstores will be built at Antonina as the region is a major producer of chickens, he said. Many other frozen foods are also expected to be exported from the port.
